trans-unit.source: Virtual machines created in Service Management are always placed in a cloud service.
trans-unit.target: Virtual machines created in Service Management are always placed in a cloud service.

trans-unit.source: The cloud service acts as a container and provides a unique public DNS name, a public IP address, and a set of endpoints to access the virtual machine over the Internet.
trans-unit.target: The cloud service acts as a container and provides a unique public DNS name, a public IP address, and a set of endpoints to access the virtual machine over the Internet.

trans-unit.source: The cloud service can optionally be in a virtual network.
trans-unit.target: The cloud service can optionally be in a virtual network.

trans-unit.source: If a cloud service isn't in a virtual network, it's called a standalone cloud service.
trans-unit.target: If a cloud service isn't in a virtual network, it's called a standalone cloud service.

trans-unit.source: The virtual machines in a standalone cloud service can only communicate with other virtual machines by using the other virtual machines’ public DNS names, and that traffic travels over the Internet.
trans-unit.target: The virtual machines in a standalone cloud service can only communicate with other virtual machines by using the other virtual machines’ public DNS names, and that traffic travels over the Internet.

trans-unit.source: If a cloud service is in a virtual network, the virtual machines in that cloud service can communicate with all other virtual machines in the virtual network without sending any traffic over the Internet.
trans-unit.target: If a cloud service is in a virtual network, the virtual machines in that cloud service can communicate with all other virtual machines in the virtual network without sending any traffic over the Internet.

trans-unit.source: If you place your virtual machines in the same standalone cloud service, you can take still use load balancing and availability sets.
trans-unit.target: If you place your virtual machines in the same standalone cloud service, you can take still use load balancing and availability sets.

trans-unit.source: For details, see <link><linkText>Load balancing virtual machines</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Manage the availability of virtual machines</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For details, see <link><linkText>Load balancing virtual machines</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Manage the availability of virtual machines</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: However, you can't organize the virtual machines on subnets or connect a standalone cloud service to your on-premises network.
trans-unit.target: However, you can't organize the virtual machines on subnets or connect a standalone cloud service to your on-premises network.

trans-unit.source: Here's an example:
trans-unit.target: Here's an example:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Virtual machines in a standalone cloud service</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Virtual machines in a standalone cloud service</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you place your virtual machines in a virtual network, you can decide how many cloud services you want to use for load balancing and availability sets.
trans-unit.target: If you place your virtual machines in a virtual network, you can decide how many cloud services you want to use for load balancing and availability sets.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, you can organize the virtual machines on subnets in the same way as your on-premises network and connect the virtual network to your on-premises network.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, you can organize the virtual machines on subnets in the same way as your on-premises network and connect the virtual network to your on-premises network.

trans-unit.source: Here's an example:
trans-unit.target: Here's an example:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Virtual machines in a virtual network</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Virtual machines in a virtual network</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Virtual networks are the recommended way to connect virtual machines in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Virtual networks are the recommended way to connect virtual machines in Azure.

trans-unit.source: The best practice is to configure each tier of your application in a separate cloud service.
trans-unit.target: The best practice is to configure each tier of your application in a separate cloud service.

trans-unit.source: However, you may need to combine some virtual machines from different application tiers into the same cloud service to remain within the maximum of 200 cloud services per subscription.
trans-unit.target: However, you may need to combine some virtual machines from different application tiers into the same cloud service to remain within the maximum of 200 cloud services per subscription.

trans-unit.source: To review this and other limits, see <link><linkText>Azure Subscription and Service Limits, Quotas, and Constraints</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To review this and other limits, see <link><linkText>Azure Subscription and Service Limits, Quotas, and Constraints</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Connect VMs in a virtual network
trans-unit.target: Connect VMs in a virtual network

trans-unit.source: To connect virtual machines in a virtual network:
trans-unit.target: To connect virtual machines in a virtual network:

trans-unit.source: Create the virtual network in the <link><linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Create the virtual network in the <link><linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Virtual Network Configuration Tasks</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Virtual Network Configuration Tasks</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Create the set of cloud services for your deployment to reflect your design for availability sets and load balancing.
trans-unit.target: Create the set of cloud services for your deployment to reflect your design for availability sets and load balancing.

trans-unit.source: In the portal, click New > Compute > Cloud Service > Custom Create for each cloud service.
trans-unit.target: In the portal, click New > Compute > Cloud Service > Custom Create for each cloud service.

trans-unit.source: To create each new virtual machine, click New > Compute > Virtual Machine > From Gallery.
trans-unit.target: To create each new virtual machine, click New > Compute > Virtual Machine > From Gallery.

trans-unit.source: Choose the correct cloud service and virtual network for the VM.
trans-unit.target: Choose the correct cloud service and virtual network for the VM.

trans-unit.source: If the cloud service is already joined to a virtual network, its name will already be selected for you.
trans-unit.target: If the cloud service is already joined to a virtual network, its name will already be selected for you.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Selecting a cloud service for a virtual machine</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Selecting a cloud service for a virtual machine</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Connect VMs in a standalone cloud service
trans-unit.target: Connect VMs in a standalone cloud service

trans-unit.source: To connect virtual machines in a standalone cloud service:
trans-unit.target: To connect virtual machines in a standalone cloud service:

trans-unit.source: Create the cloud service in the <link><linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Create the cloud service in the <link><linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Click New > Compute > Cloud Service > Custom Create.
trans-unit.target: Click New > Compute > Cloud Service > Custom Create.

trans-unit.source: Or, you can create the cloud service for your deployment when you create your first virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Or, you can create the cloud service for your deployment when you create your first virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: When you create the virtual machines, choose the name of cloud service created in the previous step.
trans-unit.target: When you create the virtual machines, choose the name of cloud service created in the previous step.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add a virtual machine to an existing cloud service</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add a virtual machine to an existing cloud service</linkText>

trans-unit.source: After you create a virtual machine, it's a good idea to add a data disk so your services and workloads have a location to store data.
trans-unit.target: After you create a virtual machine, it's a good idea to add a data disk so your services and workloads have a location to store data.

trans-unit.source: See one of the following:
trans-unit.target: See one of the following:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>How to Attach a Data Disk to a Linux Virtual Machine</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>How to Attach a Data Disk to a Linux Virtual Machine</linkText><title></title></link>
